intro: Chenopodium urbicum var. melanospermum, commonly known as black-seed goosefoot, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves that are usually covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in dense clusters, which are typically borne in terminal or axillary inflorescences. Its seeds are black and serve as a distinguishing feature, often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines. This annual species is commonly found in disturbed soils and urban environments, making it a common weed in cultivated areas.
